class.name: Trail2D
class.brief_description: A 2D trail that can optionally be textured.
class.description: This node spawns a 2D polyline trail behind it's position when transformed. [Trail2D] is not a mathematical polyline, i.e. the segments are not infinitely thin. It is intended for rendering and it can be colored and optionally textured. [b]Note:[/b] [Trail2D] is drawn using a 2D mesh.

members.member: The style of the beginning of the polyline.
The color of the polyline. Will not be used if a gradient is set.

If [code]true[/code], points are being emitted. [member emitting] can be used to start and stop points from emitting. You can use the [signal finished] signal to be notified once all active points finish processing. [b]Note:[/b] If any points remain from an earlier emitting state, they will be cleared when toggling [member emitting] back on.
The style of the end of the polyline.
The gradient is drawn through the whole trail from start to finish. The [member default_color] will not be used if this property is set.
The style of the connections between segments of the polyline.
Amount of time each point will exist.
The smoothness used for rounded joints and caps. Higher values result in smoother corners, but are more demanding to render and update.
The distance between spawned points in the trail.

Determines the miter limit of the polyline. Normally, when [member joint_mode] is set to [constant Line2D.LINE_JOINT_SHARP], sharp angles fall back to using the logic of [constant Line2D.LINE_JOINT_BEVEL] joints to prevent very long miters. Higher values of this property mean that the fallback to a bevel joint will happen at sharper angles.
The texture used for the polyline. Uses [member texture_mode] for drawing style.
The style to render the [member texture] of the polyline.
The polyline's width curve. The width of the polyline over its length will be equivalent to the value of the width curve over its domain. The width curve should be a unit [Curve].

signal.name: finished
signal.description: Emitted when all active points have finished processing.
